pageContext.claim: “Hundreds of billions of dollars more money will be spent on NATO.”
pageContext.analysis: NATO’s guideline, established in 2006, is that defense expenditures should amount to 2 percent of each country’s gross domestic product. Defense spending has increased 11.7 billion over the past year. But the money would not be going to the United States or even necessarily to NATO; this is money that countries would spend to bolster their own military, not any "reimbursement."
